post.title: OneNote Rocks
post.content: I need a better microphone for my laptop, but the ability to record the audio for a meeting and sync that audio with the notes you’re taking is brilliant. I’m using the 2007 version, but I think at least some of this functionality was available in the 2003 version.
post.excerpt: I need a better microphone for my laptop, but the ability to record the audio for a meeting and sync that audio with the notes you’re taking is brilliant. I’m using the 2007 version, but I think at least some of this functionality was available in the 2003 version.

comments.name: Dag König
comments.content:
Both features are also available in OneNote 2003. I have used it often. But sometime it makes you feel like a spy.

/dag

comments.name: Bil Simser
comments.content: I totally agree. I use OneNote for *everything* and keep a few OneNote notebook files online in SharePoint where you can just sync stuff automagically. It’s great for keeping track of little things, plus I have sections for projects, software, and a blog queue of intersting things I’ll get to one day.
